alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Inland Harris; Inland Jackson; Waller; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 8:14PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Colorado, Wharton, eastern Austin, northeastern Jackson, northwestern Fort Bend, southern Waller and west central Harris Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pattison to near Wallis to 6 miles southeast of Eagle Lake to 11 miles northeast of Speaks. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Rosenberg, Katy, El Campo, Wharton, Sealy, Brookshire, Columbus, Eagle Lake, East Bernard, Ganado, Wallis, Fulshear, Simonton, San Felipe, Beasley, Pattison, Kendleton, Orchard, Cinco Ranch and Pierce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and southeastern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Inland Harris; Inland Jackson; Waller; Wharton
